H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H4427.def: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H8323.def: = state in which humans are in a position of authority over a group of people

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H2230.def: = process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect

H6388.def: = a body of flowing water, ◄ probably dug by humans

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H6724.def: = land in which there is a lack of water or rainfall; ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert-like conditions, ≈ associated with thirst and hardship

H3515.def: = state in which an object has relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H4116.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H6703.def: = state in which the skin of humans is extremely light in color ► to the extent that it reflects light

H5036.def: = foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H5081.def: = state in which humans are willing to perform a certain task and show that by their actions

H3596.def: = dishonest and untrustworthy person ≈ of exceedingly low social status

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7771.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H5036.def: = foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H5039.def: = foolish actions that show a lack of respect for God and/or one's fellow human beings

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2612.def: = pattern of actions by which humans act as people that are impure in character, without regard or respect for God

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7457.def: = condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness

H6771.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

H2637.def: = state in which humans or objects are found less in quantity or entirely absent in a location where they are supposed to be present

H4945.def: = a liquid for humans to drink

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H3596.def: = dishonest and untrustworthy person ≈ of exceedingly low social status

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H2154.def: = a project or scheme as conceived in the heart or mind, which can be either bad or good

H6035.def: = state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H5081.def: = state in which humans are willing to perform a certain task and show that by their actions

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H7600.def: = state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear, which can easily lead to carelessness and arrogance

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H238.def: = to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

H565.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7264.def: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

H1210.def: = pattern of actions by which humans harvest the grapes that have matured and are ready for picking

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H625.def: = act of bringing in crops from the field at the time of harvest

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H2729.def: = state/process by which inanimate objects shake or tremble violently

H7600.def: = state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear, which can easily lead to carelessness and arrogance

H7264.def: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

H6584.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which a locust sheds its skin

H6209.def: = action by which humans remove their clothes

H2296.def: = state in which someone wears clothes or armor

H2504.def: = area located on both sides of spine between false ribs and hip-bone; ◄ part of human body; ≈ often used to indicate the entire waist region of the body; euphemism for male genitals

H5594.def: = action by which human perform the mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include {L:wailing<SDBH:ילל>}, tearing one's clothes, putting on {L:sackcloth<SDBH:שַׂק>}, covering oneself with dust or ashes, {L:fasting<SDBH:צום>} or eating specific food, {L:cutting oneself<SDBH:גדד>}, {L:shaving one's head<SDBH:קרח>}, covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

H2531.def: = state in which objects have such a high quality ► that they provoke in others the desire to possess them

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H6509.def: = process by which humans, animals, or plants produce much offspring, ► and so grow in number and strength

H1612.def: = a creeping plant, which grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H6975.def: = small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction

H8068.def: = a legendary rock or mineral, known for its hardness; ≈ associated with an inflexible mind

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H4885.def: poetic term; = state in which humans, deities, and animals feel and show great joy

H7151.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H759.def: = building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace

H5203.def: = process by which ropes that used to be tightly strung begin to hang loose

H1995.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H6076.def: always as K of {L:טְחֹרִים<SDBH:טְחֹרִים>}; exact meaning uncertain: = swelling of internal parts of the body or sores; ◄ probably due to an infectious disease such as dysentery or bubonic plague; ≈ regarded as painful, enfeebling and threatening to a community

H975.def: exact meaning unsure: = construction from which a relatively large area can be overlooked; ► built in order to provide security and protection to the surrounding area

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H4631.def: = a large open place on the side of a rock or mountain, ► used for burying and hiding, or as a temporary dwelling place

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H4885.def: poetic term; = state in which humans, deities, and animals feel and show great joy

H6501.def: = wild donkey of a relatively large size but with relatively small ears; it has a fawn color with a whitish chest and belly; ◄ Persian Wild Ass or Onager, Equus hemonius; ≈ associated with both untameable wildness and sexual desire

H4829.def: = open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats

H5739.def: = a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H6168.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause the outer layer covering an object to be removed

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H3759.def: = newly ripened grain which has just been harvested and which has not yet been dried for storage or for grinding into flour

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H3759.def: = newly ripened grain which has just been harvested and which has not yet been dried for storage or for grinding into flour

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H8252.def: = state in which an inanimate object does not move

H983.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H4908.def: = location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

H4009.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H7600.def: = state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear, which can easily lead to carelessness and arrogance

H4496.def: literally: rest; hence: = a state of mind in which humans find relief after a time of distress

H1258.def: = process by which pellets of frozen rain fall from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H2232.def: = action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2543.def: = domestic animal belonging to the same family as the horse, but smaller and with longer ears; it can have variety of colors from dark brown, through light brown to gray and occasionally white; ◄ |iEquus Asinus africanus;|i* ► used to ride on, carry loads, or do other work; ≈ highly regarded; for male see {L:עַיִר<SDBH:עַיִר>}; female see {L:אָתֹון<SDBH:אָתֹון>}

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

12.gl: to thrust aside (someone's) feet > to send (someone) sprawling
